author: vicepool
title: Avatarada
description: Users have to register/manage separate accounts for different Cardano projects. Poorly made projects can incur the leak of personal data.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal hits the nail on the head in terms of impact on the Cardano community. 
Starting from this assumption.

"In the crypto space, wallet owners prefer to stay anonymous. The purpose of Avatarada is to provide websites with the required minimum amount of personal information about the user. 

and continuing with this solution.

"Avatarada will provide a single place for users' accounts that any website or mobile app can effortlessly implement using an open-standard OAuth2 authentication."

Say no more for all of the community who value the privacy of their credentials.

Will this proposal, if implemented as predicted, impact positively on the Cardano community? I have no question. 5 Stars
f6_assessments.q1:
There might be many questions or concerns if any first time proposer was suggesting they could solve the privacy concerns. But this team has already proven their capabilities in developing the quite surprising and very useful CardanoWall system. An intuitive interface, interacting with the Blockchain behind the scene they have proven they understand the market and the technical systems. That they have already assembled a dev team further enhances the feasibility of completion.

"At the moment, we have a brilliant team of three backend developers, two frontend developers, one designer, and one system administrator. They all have experience and understanding of the Cardano blockchain since we already built ADAPlus blockchain explorer and currently working on an open-source mass-payment solution."

All together - one of the few 5-5 Stars proposals, in my book
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is a bit light on auditability, simply saying they will launch their solution on two websites as a test, then seek others. There are no interim steps. But, that is not unusual in a pure development proposal. If they do launch they have met their promises. If they don't they can explain why. So 4 stars.

f6_assessments.q0: OAuth2 within Cardano is a huge step in helping to streamline and mainstream a lot of the authentication processes that would make the protocol more user friendly for applications and users.  This would have huge impacts on the way software would be designed and authenticate users.
f6_assessments.q1: Considering that the funding asked for will not cover the whole costs and that the proposer will cover some other costs out of hand given their previous developments made in the space give a lot of confidence that the team could deliver on this.  They have a team already in house and could hit the ground running on this project.  Milestones are provided on how they will tackle the development side of the project.
f6_assessments.q2: There are very little cold hard metrics, but it is necessary for 2 in house project in development already.  The timeline for those project could also help make a stronger point as to when development milestones are targeted to be reached.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem has been stated clearly namely that Users have to register/manage separate accounts for different Cardano projects. Poorly made projects can incur the leak of personal data. . The solution proposed is to Introduce secure OAuth2 with Cardano wallets will make it easier for users to manage accounts and will also speed up development time. This will positively impact the ecosystem saving time and effort of users and developers. Similar to a "Log in with Facebook" or Login with Google mechanism.
f6_assessments.q1:
While the roadmap and timelines have been well laid out as follows -
 Design, UI/UX.
Initial development with wallets registration.
Initial alpha launch with OAuth2 with connecting services
Implementing extended API for querying the blockchain.
API for delivering messages from services to users (Inbox).
Notification through different communication channels (emails, Telegram bot).
Public API with public wallet details for blockchain explorers and wallets integration.

and the budget has been laid out in detail, the team membesr have not been detailed. No profiles have been given.Budget is quite high
f6_assessments.q2: Metrics are not adequate. No contingency plans are provided. No KPIs given. Nothing auditable is given which needs to improve their auditability.  They need to be aware of ways to solve contingencies.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal seems to create an open source authentication infrastructure that allows users to operate various wallets from one account login details in addition, helps to development of projects as developers can integrate this tool without having to implement login functionalities with various wallets using the open source authentication structure This is an awesome and welcome idea as it intends to create a great user experience and an open source tool for easy and increased development of projects by the developers in the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal provided relevant and reliable information showing that the proposal can be reasonably concluded. There were list of intended goals without any timelines or milestones attached however from the information provided, the team has been involved in some successfully funded and active projects which shows that they are well experienced and competent. The budget breakdown and analysis looks reasonable and achievable. Am convinced that the project will be successfully implemented accordingly.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has provided more enough information for the community to conveniently monitor and assess the progress and development of the project. The proposal plans to implement the proposal on their existing active projects to be presented to community. In addition, relevant Success Metric was provided to verify the success of the project such as the number of external projects to be onboarded within a timeline. Am confident that the information provided is more than enough to ensure effective monitoring and audit of the project if eventually funded.

f6_assessments.q0: An OAuth2 based access management for Cardano related apps or for that matter any web service can significantly benefit the developer community and also enable bring new ideas for IAM using Cardano wallets. This will be a great addition to the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer had implemented Cardanowall ( provided proof of existence service)  and an SPO with 1.5M live stake. He also has 15 years of experience in software engineering. The proposal is clearly being out the technical features and seems to have no major technical risk. Therefore the proposal is highly feasible.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal aims to provide OAuth2 as a service based on the Cardano wallet. This is a simple and testable end state. More they also expect to onboard at least 5 new projects by July. this can be used to measure the success of the project. The fund requested is about 65K and has a detailed breakdown. From the analysis, it looks reasonable.

solution: Introducing secure OAuth2 with Cardano wallets will make it easier for users to manage accounts and will also speed up development time.
experience: Two co-proposers. Over 15y of experience as SW engineers, entrepreneurs, marketers. From the developers of CardanoWall and ADAPlus Mass-Payments and PoolBoost.
